page.title: 01 General Review of the Area
page.content: Our 12sq.Km. around Beck Row can be divided into three main categories. (1)Military Airfield (2)Residential (3)Farmland. Apart from R.A.F.Mildenhall, there are the two main villages of Beck Row and Holywell Row and the small hamlet of Wilde Street. The area is only 6m. above sea level and on the edge of a large area of fenland which extends North to The Wash. There are no streams in the area in I985 apart from the man-made Cut-Off Channel,but previously there were several brooks or becks and much marshy ground. The land is now mainly dry sandy soil with chalk sub-soil and the occasional area of dry peat, due to the draining of the fen and extraction of water which is pumped to Essex.
